Description: Lower body sherd of Chian, possibly Wild Goat Style, pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky brown (partly worn); trace of single added red band; exterior, slip worn: simple maeander band above wide band fired red-brown; inscription on exterior.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis), Context Φ5(?). The number '5' in pencil on the inside may refer rather to a series of Chian chalices. (?)
Curator's comments: The number 5 is written in pencil on the interior surface. Possibly a context number (Context Φ5?) The lower body of Wild Goat Style chalices is usually more elaborately decorated than those in later styles. For the maeander pattern and band on the exterior, compare Lemos nos 927 and 928 from Tocra.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0084) (phase 2)
